channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What to know about former U.K. leader Tony Blair, tapped by Trump for postwar Gaza role
item.description: As Britain's prime minister, Tony Blair succeeded in negotiating peace in Northern Ireland in 1998. Five years later, he joined the U.S.-led invasion ...

item.title: A public broadcaster's path after losing U.S. funds: Youth sports and less local news
item.description: South Dakota Public Broadcasting says there's an ironic result to President Trump's successful attack on public media: It will have to rely more on NP...

item.title: Even a government shutdown can't stop the quiz. Can you score 11?
item.description: This week's quiz also features bears.

item.title: UK police release names of the 2 victims of the Manchester synagogue attack
item.description: Greater Manchester Police named Adrian Daulby, 53, and Melvin Cravitz, 66 as the victims of Thursday's attack. Three more remain hospitalized in serio...

item.title: Sarah Mullally named first woman Archbishop of Canterbury
item.description: Sarah Mullally has been named as the new Archbishop of Canterbury, becoming the first woman to be chosen to lead the world's 85 million Anglicans.

item.title: Munich airport reopens after drone sightings force closure
item.description: Dozens of flights were cancelled or redirected at Munich International Airport after drone sightings.

item.title: Trump administration taps Army Reserve and National Guard for temporary immigration judges
item.description: The Trump administration is tapping National Guard and Army Reserve lawyers to be temporary immigration judges after firing dozens of existing judges.

item.title: As U.S. hiring slows, more Americans are job hunting for months
item.description: The number of unemployed people looking for work more than six months has surged to its highest level since 2021.

item.title: Iconic studio used by the Beatles and Rolling Stones reopening in London
item.description: Regent Sound studio, which The Who's Pete Townshend called a "massive part of rock history," was silent for decades. It's been revived as a landmark s...

item.title: 10/2: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: Government shutdown stretches into day two with no sign of deal; New book reflects on inequality, democracy, and values Americans share

item.title: Behind the Gen Z protesters who want to force Madagascar's president from power
item.description: President Rajoelina's move fails to quell the protest movement that is now threatening his own position.

item.title: Health centers face risks as government funding lapses
item.description: Community health centers are key to delivering care in underserved communities around the country, but their services could be disrupted or scaled bac...

item.title: Thai killer of Cambodian opposition politician sentenced to life in prison
item.description: Lim Kimya was shot dead in Bangkok in January, in what many believe was a political killing.

item.title: Taylor Swift on Travis, new tracks and baking bread
item.description: The global superstar spoke to Radio 1's Greg James about how her new album reflects her current era.

item.title: Japan faces Asahi beer shortage after cyber-attack
item.description: The drinks giant said this week that the attack had a major impact on its domestic operations.

item.title: Supreme Court gears up for new term with cases on social issues, Trump policies

item.title: FDA approves another generic abortion pill, prompting outrage from conservatives
Trump uses government shutdown to dole out firings and political punishment
